titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [3. 7. 1914]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 151; deutsch: Briefe, S. 57; Cambridge Letters, S. 89f.; WiC, S. 75).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Upon clearing up some papers before leaving Skjolden I popped upon your letter which had made me so wilde. And upon reading it over again I found that I had probably no sufficient reason to write to you as I did. (Not that I like your letter a bit now) But at any rate my wrath has cooled down & I'ld rather be friends with you again than otherwise. I consider, I have strained myself enough now for I would not have written this to many people & if you don't answer this I sha'n't write to you again.
